info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 2:45AM MDT until June 14 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Boulder River at Big Timber affecting Sweet Grass County. Stillwater River near Absarokee affecting Stillwater County. .The Boulder and Stillwater rivers are rising quickly due to rapid snowmelt and recent rainfall. The rivers may approach or exceed flood stage over the next few days. Minor flooding of low lying areas near the rivers is possible. Significant erosion is likely. River levels are expected to drop after Tuesday with colder temperatures in the high country slowing snow melt. For the Stillwater River...including Absarokee...flooding is possible. For the Boulder River...including Big Timber...flooding is possible. * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Boulder River at Big Timber. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Minor flooding along the south bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Boulder River Big Timber 8.0 6.9 Sun 1 am 7.8 7.4 6.0 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday morning at 715 AM MDT.
